question.title: Structured output with full response content and additional metadata
question.body:
I want to create a structured output from an agent call that contains the full response content, as well as additional metadata.

For example, I am making a call to find the differences between two strings:

chatClient.prompt(prompt)
    .call()
    .entity(MappedResponse.class)

MappedResponse:

public class MappedResponse {
    String llmResponse;
    boolean foundDifferences;
}

I expected the llmResponse to contain the same response as a call without the entity mapping:

chatClient.prompt(prompt)
        .call()

But that does not happen, instead I get a shortened version of that response mapped into llmResponse.

So the question is, how do I map the full agent response into MappedResponse while still being able to map additional fields such as foundDifferences?

answers.body:
I think easiest solution would be get the response in this format

HashMap<String, Object> response = chatClient.prompt(prompt)
    .call()
    .entity(new ParameterizedTypeReference<HashMap<String, Object>>() {});

ParametrizedTypeReference can handle all data and generate a map from it, then in next step you can check the object names and create MappedResponse from it. This way you get all data in a map.

This approach used in RestTemplate in spring heavily.

question_comments.body: Please share the prompt and the model that you are using in your program. Furthermore, you are not using any BeanOutputConverter class to convert the LLM output to a specific object type using JSON schema. You can also refer to this article.
